file_content.text: You're calling the shots now. I'm only here to help.
Don't worry, I'll stick close to you.
There's my duplicate. Should only take a few moments to thaw him out.
We need to make it look convincing. A couple of blaster shots should sell it. Want to do the honors?
This is your scam--you can do the work.
No.
Fine, this'll only take a second.
Right between the eyes?
Sure. [Shoot the corpse once.]
We'll tell everyone you went out in a blaze of glory.
Yes! [Perforate the corpse.]
Oh my stars! I'm glad we decided to work together.
Let me collect my gear, and we can be on our way.
So, I'll need a new name. After all, Tyresius Lokai is dead.
What do you think of the name Gault Rennow? Has a nice ring to it....
Call yourself whatever you like.
I couldn't care less.
It's not bad. Kind of catchy.
Sounds good.
Yes. A fine name for an exciting new life.
"Gault" suits you just fine, scum-sucker.
Better than Tyresius.
Then Gault Rennow it is. A fine new name for an exciting new life.
Why don't you and "Gault" spend a little time getting to know each other? I'll see you two back at the ship.
Lead on, my fearsome friend. Gault is ready for action!
Come on, you hunk of junk! Blast! I knew there wasn't enough power to take off.
End of the line, Tyresius.
You're the toughest, most persistent bounty hunter I've ever met. I have only one thing left to say.
Give me a job.
Spare my life, and I'll dedicate it to working for you. How's that sound?
Why in the galaxy would I ever believe you, Tyresius?
Like a lie.
I have to bring you in dead, pal.
Complicated.
All you need is my corpse. I've got that covered.
That may be the funniest thing I've ever heard.
Laughable.
It's not a joke.
I'm tired of running. My fortune's gone, but I'm still hunted. I want Tyresius Lokai dead as much as anyone.
What if I told you there's a duplicate of yours truly? A replica identical in all respects? Even a bioscan couldn't tell the difference.
Where did you get this perfect duplicate?
Never heard of such a thing.
A scientist on Nar Shaddaa made it. Amazing what's for sale there.
Is this duplicate on your ship?
Where is this replica?
Why else would I have come back here? That duplicate was my escape plan.
You made a copy of yourself? One was bad enough.
How disgusting.
My duplicate is already dead, frozen in carbonite. Just pretend he's me.
Once I'm declared dead, I'll put my legendary skills, savvy and contacts at your disposal. Imagine what we could accomplish.
What's to keep you from disappearing at the next spaceport?
For how long?
I'm deeply wounded by your mistrust, yet reassured by your intelligence.
I see a lot of trouble in my future if I keep you around.
I'm imagining, all right.
Trouble is just another word for opportunity--and that leads to profit.
The thought of blasting you in the face is all that's kept me going.
But I want to shoot you!
I'm really worth more to you alive.
I hate to say it, but having him on our team might be useful.
I swear I'll never run. I'm safer as your servant than as a fugitive.
Even if I did escape, you'd just find me again. Honestly, who wants to have this conversation twice?
Someone of your talents might come in handy.
All right, you're hired.
Fantastic. You won't regret this.
This is so crazy, it just might work.
You talked me into it.
Crazy successful, bounty hunter! I guarantee it!
You better hope this works.
Shall we head to the cargo hold and get my duplicate?
All right, you win. Let's cut a deal.
Hope springs eternal for you, doesn't it?
You're quite an optimist.
Huh. Everything is negotiable. Everything.
I might be open to that.
I don't want to do this, but I have no choice.
This is the famous Star of Aldera. The most valuable gem in the galaxy.
No, master! Not your most prized possession! We must fight!
Quiet, NK! We'd never stand a chance.
Alderaan's royal family would pay a fortune to get this gem back. Let me go, and it's yours.
Do I look that gullible to you?
You think I'm stupid?
Can't blame a guy for trying.
Take the gem anyway--I insist!
For that kind of money, who needs the Great Hunt?
Deal. [Take the jewel.]
What are you doing?
Silly girl! Your friend sees what's important.
You've more than earned this, friend. Look at how the gem sparkles and shines....
I'll kill you and have that gem, too.
No deal. [Attack]
There's only one thing I want--your head.
Not interested. [Attack]
Phooey!
Girls! Come to daddy! It's dinner time!
Going somewhere, Tyresius?
You're too late.
Not with all those dune rats nipping at my heels. Thanks for clearing that up.
You're sure she's ready for take-off?
I've checked the calculations four times, master. With shields at minimum--
Right, right, good enough. That just leaves our friend here to deal with.
If you want something done right, do it yourself. Open fire, NK!
How long can it take to get departure clearance from this lousy spaceport? Stupid locals....
You look lost, friend. Can I help you?
Are you Gellar Roing?
We'll see.
That's right. Roing's the name, speeders my game. You in the market? One of the new T-9s, perhaps?
They said you'd be hard to catch, Lokai. Guess they were wrong.
Hello, Tyresius.
I'm afraid you're mistaken. I'm Gellar Roing, speeder salesman from Nar Shaddaa.
If you're in the market, I have great deals on the new T-9s.
Unfortunately, I'm a bit rushed. Look me up on Nar Shaddaa, won't you? The name's Roing--that's R-O-I-N-G.
You're not going anywhere, smuggler.
Don't move.
Easy, now. Don't get excited. This is a simple misunderstanding.
Drop the act. You're Tyresius Lokai.
That's not your name.
Sorry, I don't know any Tyresius. Who exactly are you, if you don't mind me asking?
I'm a bounty hunter. What else would I be?
Who do I look like?
That's absurd. I've never done anything wrong in my life.
You can call me "Lucky," now that I've caught you.
My name's not important.
Caught me? Goodness, caught me doing what?
Shoot, you fools!
I'm the last face you'll ever see.
I'm the end of you. [Attack.]
Oh, shut up! [Attack.]
No, but you can die. [Attack]
Pardon me, friend. I'm busy selling speeders to these gentlebeings.
